description: Sunlit atolls, turquoise waves and coconut-scented breezes - a soundtrack for Lakshadweep escapes.

items.name: Minicoy Island: Go For A Boat Ride
Kadmat Island: Relish Delicious Local Food
Marine Museum: An Encounter With The Underwater World
Pitti Bird Sanctuary: Spot Some Birds
Kalpeni Island: Take A Relaxing Stroll
Agatti Island: For Smoked Tuna Fish And More
items.description: This island is one of the most accessible spots in the region, as it has an airport that hosts weekly flights from Kochi airport. From the airport; the Lagoon beach is a 20-minute drive. Try the local food and the dried or smoked tuna fish when in the Agatti islands. This island has many food options, even if you are a vegetarian. There are many homestays and hotels to choose from. It is also home to some of the most prominent Lakshadweep tourist spots.

items.name: Kiltan Island: The Colonial Spot
items.description: Most traveled from the seaport of Mangalore, this island is known for its many spots with colonial prominence. The city was a point on the trade route between Ceylon and the Persian Gulf. This place is located 52 kilometres from the main island of Amini. The island is home to many stunning reefs and lagoons that Lakshadweep has to offer.

items.name: Amini Beach: For Scuba Diving And More
items.description: Amini Beach is an incredible spot for people who are looking for serene tourist places in Lakshadweep. Located on Amini Island, this beach is popular because it is covered with coral sandstone. You can try various adventurous activities like snorkeling, scuba diving, reef walking, and kayaking. Amini Beach is perfect for relaxing and spending a day while basking in the sun and sipping cocktails.

items.name: Andrott Island: For The History Enthusiasts
items.description: Andrott Island is one of the largest islands in Lakshadweep and is known for the Saint Ubaidullah Tomb in the Jumaat mosque. You can spot octopuses and other marine creatures on this island. Andrott Island is one of the best places to visit in Lakshadweep if you are a history buff. It is also famous for the ancient Buddhist ruins found here.
